name: followership
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the act of following a leader, or the behaviour of people who follow a leader: She was described as "a remarkable leader who inspires followership". The party's crisis is a crisis of followership as much as a crisis of leadership.
[ S ] a group of people who follow someone such as a leader or an influencer (= someone who is paid by a company to encourage people to buy their products on social media): Once you've built a followership, it's easy to get people to visit your site. The party and its followership appear to be at a crossroads. Synonym
following
More examplesFewer examplesThe opposition accused the government of followership, not leadership.A discussion of leadership that does not consider followership is incomplete.The best advice is to follow people who you find interesting, and single out those who already have a large followership.Follow these tips and you'll soon have a massive followership.
